tweet: Warning Monero users: If you downloaded Monero in the past 24 hours you may have installed malware. Monero's official website served compromised binaries for at least 30 minutes during the past 24 hours. Investigations are ongoing.  https://t.co/geqA4dIPar
#Monero Security Warning:  CLI binaries available on  https://t.co/UYopePqqdo may have been compromised at some point during the last 24h. Investigations ongoing.   https://t.co/BqnONy4PPg
Monero’s official website was hacked to distribute malware  https://t.co/4Q91SA3e9x

Always verify your downloads using known PGP keys.   Also a good example of routine hard forks putting average users at increased risk. Monero is forking at the end of the month so users need to download new clients before then.

10 hours after @Monero disclosed on Reddit that their official download page served malware yesterday:  1. No warning is on  https://t.co/0SrORkkHxO 2. Only social media followers see the warnings, no new blog posts. 3. No PGP-signed announcements have been made.  https://t.co/v5oi5maREL
Coin Stealer Found in Monero Linux Binaries From Official Site - by @serghei  https://t.co/IGNTqyd39J

Official Monero website compromised with malware that steals funds  > Compromised: Monero's Linux CLI binary (used for CLI wallets) > Monero team says file was available for download only 35 mins > At least one user reported losing $7k   https://t.co/ymoOZTf0lU  https://t.co/IUcpGfukSb

Grin has unique strengths and weaknesses. Monero has unique strengths and weaknesses. Zcash has unique strengths and weaknesses. It's 2019, this is a new space, and *all* of the privacy coins have threats to harden against (metadata analysis, communication-layer surveillance, &c)
